item.title: Five Stocks To Buy Today: Delhivery, Tata Motors, LIC Housing, Astral And Bharat Dynamics - NDTV Profit
item.description:
Five Stocks To Buy Today: Delhivery, Tata Motors, LIC Housing, Astral And Bharat Dynamics

Date: 16 Dec 2024, Source: NDTV Profit

Analysts have recommended ‘Buy’ calls on shares of Delhivery, Tata Motors, LIC Housing, Astral, and Bharat Dynamics for December 16, with target prices and performance insights.

  • Delhivery: Buy at Rs 385, target Rs 445, stop loss Rs 353. Potential upside of 16.2%.
  • Tata Motors: Buy at Rs 782, target Rs 920, stop loss Rs 730. Potential upside of 21.2%.
  • LIC Housing: Buy at Rs 610, target Rs 685, stop loss Rs 574. Potential upside of 19.8%.
  • Astral: Buy at Rs 1,800, target Rs 2,010, stop loss Rs 1,690. Potential upside of 12.9%.
  • Bharat Dynamics: Buy at Rs 1,250, target Rs 1,365, stop loss Rs 1,187.

With the stock markets trending upward, these stocks represent promising investment opportunities.

item.title: Vishal Mega Mart IPO allotment: How to check status online on KFin Technologies, NSE, BSE - Upstox
item.description:
Vishal Mega Mart IPO allotment: How to check status online on KFin Technologies, NSE, BSE

Publication Date: December 16
Source: Upstox

Introduction

The allotment of the ₹8,000 crore Vishal Mega Mart IPO, which was highly oversubscribed, is expected to be finalized soon, with investors eager to check the status online.

Key Points

  • The IPO was subscribed 27.28 times overall.
  • Qualified institutional buyers showed significant interest with an 80.75 times subscription.
  • Retail investors had a subscription rate of 2.31 times.
  • IPO listing date on BSE and NSE is set for December 18.
  • Price band was fixed at ₹74-₹78 per share.

How to Check IPO Status

On Kfin Technologies:

  • Visit the Kfin Technologies' IPO allotment status page.
  • Select one of the five server links.
  • If allotted, select the company's name from the dropdown.
  • Provide your application number, Demat account number, or PAN.
  • Complete the captcha and submit.

On NSE:

  • Go to the NSE IPO bid verification page.
  • New users must register.
  • Choose 'Vishal Mega Mart'.
  • Enter your application number.
  • Click on submit.

Conclusion

Vishal Mega Mart aims to serve the middle and lower-middle-income groups in India, operating 626 stores as of June 2024. Investors are anticipating the IPO allotment, which is crucial for the company's market entry.

item.title: Stocks To Watch Today: RIL, Afcons Infra, Nazara Tech, Paytm, Swiggy and other stocks in focus on Dec 16 - ET Now
item.description:
Stocks To Watch Today: RIL, Afcons Infra, Nazara Tech, Paytm, Swiggy and other stocks in focus on Dec 16

Publication Date: Updated Dec 16, 2024
Source: ET NOW News

The Gift Nifty suggests a flat start for Sensex and Nifty. The Sensex rose significantly on Friday, while several stocks are poised for attention today due to various acquisitions and orders.

  • Reliance Industries: Acquired a 74% stake in Navi Mumbai IIA for Rs 1,628.03 crore.
  • Bharat Forge: Acquired a 25% stake in Edgelab S.p.A for €2.5 million.
  • Aurobindo Pharma: Ordered to reverse ITC and GST payments of Rs 5.68 crore.
  • Lupin: Acquired three anti-diabetes trademarks from Boehringer Ingelheim.
  • Vedanta: Announcing its fourth interim dividend for FY 2024-25.
  • Paytm: Sold 5.4% stake in PayPay Corp to SoftBank for Rs 2,364 crore.
  • Dixon Technologies: Forming a joint venture with Vivo to manufacture smartphones.
  • JK Paper: Merging its three subsidiaries and acquiring a majority stake in Radhesham Wellpack.
  • HG Infra: Secured a Rs 862 crore order for highway construction.
  • Afcons Infrastructure: Received an LOA for the Rs 1,006.74 crore Bhopal Metro Phase 1 project.
  • Jaiprakash Power Ventures: Stay on penalties for illegal sand extraction.
  • Lemon Tree Hotels: Signed a new property in Bhuj, Gujarat.
Disclaimer: The above article is meant for informational purposes only and should not be considered as any investment advice.

This article outlines significant movements and acquisitions in the stock market, suggesting potential investment interests for traders and investors.

item.title: MobiKwik IPO allotment: How to check status online on Link Intime India, NSE, BSE - Upstox
item.description:
MobiKwik IPO allotment: How to check status online on Link Intime India, NSE, BSE

Date: December 16, 2023   Source: Financial News

The MobiKwik IPO allotment status will be finalized on December 16. Users can verify their allotment status online through the Link Intime India, NSE, and BSE websites, with shares set to list on December 18.

  • The IPO received bids for over 14.17 crore shares, leading to a subscription rate of 119.38 times.
  • Retail investors subscribed 134.67 times the designated quota.
  • The company raised ₹257 crore from anchor investors prior to the offering.
  • The price range for shares was set between ₹265-₹279.
“The total subscription of the IPO reached 119.38 times, showcasing strong demand.”

The listing of One MobiKwik Systems is anticipated to be a significant event for investors, highlighting the growing interest in fintech companies in India.

item.title: Gold Price Forecast: XAU/USD holds steady below $2,650 ahead of US PMI data - FXStreet
item.description:
Gold Price Stable Below $2,650 Ahead of US PMI Data

Date & Source: January 2024, FXStreet

Introduction: The gold price (XAU/USD) remains stable around $2,650 in early Asian trading on Monday. Central bank demand and geopolitical tensions are expected to support gold prices, while upcoming US PMI data could influence market sentiment.

  1. Gold price holds steady near $2,650 in early Asian trading.
  2. Central bank buying and geopolitical risks in the Middle East support gold prices.
  3. Investors await US December PMI data for market direction.
  4. Trump's tariff plan could cap gold's upside due to inflation concerns.
  5. Fed meeting on Wednesday expected to cut interest rates by 25 basis points.
Significant demand from central banks lifts the yellow metal price. Central banks have been net buyers of gold for nearly 15 years, emphasizing its value as a crisis hedge and a reliable reserve asset.

Conclusion: Gold prices are likely to remain supported by central bank demand and geopolitical risks, but Trump's tariff plan and Fed policy will be key factors influencing its movement.

item.title: GIFT Nifty down 100 points; here's the trading setup for today's session - The Economic Times
item.description:
GIFT Nifty down 100 points; here's the trading setup for today's session

Date: [Publication Date Unknown] | Source: Economic Times

The markets continued their positive momentum for the fourth consecutive week, gaining nearly half a percent ahead of key economic indicators.

  • GIFT Nifty traded lower by 98 points, signaling a negative start for Dalal Street.
  • Technical view suggests potential for the index to reach 25,000 in the short term, with support at 24,550.
  • India VIX fell, indicating reduced fear in the markets.
  • U.S. stocks showed little movement with mixed performances among major indices.
  • Asian stocks traded narrowly, influenced by regulatory stabilization efforts in China.
  • Oil prices eased as investors await signals from the Federal Reserve regarding rate cuts.
  • The U.S. dollar approached a three-week high with expectations of interest rate adjustments.
  • Foreign portfolio investors became net buyers, while domestic institutions sold shares.
  • The rupee settled higher against the dollar, helped by domestic market recovery.
Foreign portfolio investors turned net buyers at Rs 2335 crore on Wednesday.

In conclusion, GIFT Nifty is indicating a cautious start as traders await critical economic announcements.

item.title: Bonus, Stock Split, Dividend Alert: Maruti Suzuki-backed company, Linc see corporate actions this week - CNBCTV18
item.description:
Bonus, Stock Split, Dividend Alert: Maruti Suzuki-backed company, Linc see corporate actions this week

Date: Not specified | Source: CNBC TV18

This week, several companies are set to undertake corporate actions, including stock splits and bonus issues, relevant to their shareholders. Notable actions include those from companies associated with Maruti Suzuki.

  • Bharat Seats: Announced a 1:1 bonus issue, record date is December 20.
  • Linc: Announced a bonus issue and a stock split (1 share of ₹10 into 2 shares of ₹5), record date is December 20.
  • Shish Industries: Will split one share of ₹10 into ten shares of ₹1; record date is December 17.
  • Styrenix Performance Materials: Declared an interim dividend of ₹31; record date is December 17.
  • Rajeshwari Cans: Announced a 1:1 bonus issue; record date is December 19.

item.title: In our sector, trust and credentials are key: Shriram Finance’s Venkatraman | Company Business News - Mint
item.description:
Shriram Finance's Venkatraman Discusses Trust and Digital Experiences

Publication Date: October 2023 | Source: Mint

Recently, Shriram Finance Ltd launched a brand campaign featuring cricket legend Rahul Dravid, emphasizing trust and customer-centricity amidst a digital experience-driven market. Executive Director Elizabeth Venkatraman elaborates on the campaign’s strategy and brand priorities.

  • Focus on building consumer trust through engaging digital experiences.
  • Incorporation of sports metaphors to unify brand messaging.
  • Insights into the demands and expectations of Gen Z consumers.
  • The campaign aims to align with Shriram Finance's inclusive approach to marketing.
“In our sector, trust and credentials are key.” - Elizabeth Venkatraman

This campaign showcases Shriram Finance's commitment to meeting evolving customer expectations while enhancing its brand image.

item.title: Rs 12 lakh crore loans written off in 10 years, half of it by PSU banks in last 5 years - The Times of India
item.description:
Rs 12 lakh crore loans written off in 10 years, half of it by PSU banks in last 5 years

Publication Date: Not specified | Source: Times of India

This article discusses the significant financial write-offs by banks in India over the last decade, focusing on Public Sector Undertaking (PSU) banks.

  • Over Rs 12 lakh crore in loans have been written off in the past 10 years.
  • Half of the total write-offs occurred in the last five years.
  • PSU banks contributed a substantial portion of these write-offs.
"The cumulative write-off signifies a growing trend among banks to manage bad debts through loan forgiveness instead of recovery efforts."

This trend raises important questions about the implications for banks and the economy moving forward.

item.title: Banks struggle to meet SEBI's cybersecurity deadline amid new regulations - The Economic Times
item.description:
Banks Struggle to Meet SEBI's Cybersecurity Deadline Amid New Regulations

Publication Date: Not specified, Source: Economic Times

Banks are facing challenges in meeting the January 1 deadline set by SEBI to implement a cybersecurity framework, with many banks, particularly multinational lenders, requesting more time to comply with the demanding regulations.

  • Banks are overwhelmed by numerous new regulations regarding cybersecurity and resilience frameworks.
  • SEBI has mandated that regulatory data must be accessible and usable while adhering to legal standards.
  • KPMG's Kunal Pande highlights the increased scrutiny and reporting demands placed on banks.
  • Regulated entities are required to conduct biannual cyber-resilience tests involving third-party service providers.
  • Concerns about legacy systems and compliance with cybersecurity measures will require banks to adapt quickly.
“Banks are trying to come to terms with the regulatory norms. Not reporting would mean not demonstrating compliance, and no entity would want that.” - Kunal Pande, KPMG

SEBI's framework implementation may delay, but it emphasizes on the criticality of enhancing cybersecurity protocols in the banking sector.
